greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the start position for a Sankt-Petrus-game with n white and n black stones and the least step A187788(n).
comment: Beginning at the position a(n) with the least step A187788(n) (n-1) white stones were eliminated; then starting at the position 1 of the last white stone, n black stones were eliminated.
reference: W. Ahrens, Das Josephusspiel, Archiv für Kulturgeschichte, Jg 11(1913), 129-151.
R. Baumann, Computer Knobelei, LOG IN, Heft 165(2010), 68-71.
link: Index entries for sequences related to the Josephus Problem
example: n=8; WWBBWBBWWBBWWBWB; step=A187788(8)=3; start=a(8)=7; elimination: white stones: {9,12,15,2,5,8,13}, black stones: {4,10,16,6,14,7,3,11}.
maple: for j from 1 to n-1 do z[j]:=z[j]+1: end do:
for j from 1 to n1 do
for k from 1 to (s-2) do  zp:=z[zp]: end do:
if (h=1) then a[n1]:=1: else a[n1]:=n+2-h: end if:
for p from 2 to 100 by 2 do  p1:=p-1: p2:=p+1:
if (b=1) and (a[p1]=0) then stone(p1): end if:
if (c=1) and (a[p]=0) then stone(p): end if:
results.author: _Paul Weisenhorn_, Jan 06 2013
